alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 9:27PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Snow Overnight into Thursday Morning... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service in Cheyenne. * WHAT...Rain and snow showers, transitioning to full snow overnight into Thursday morning, moderate to heavy at times. Lower elevations across the High Plains could see 2 to 4 inches of snow. Locally higher amounts of 4-7" can`t be fully ruled out if snow transition occurs earlier this evening or local heavy banding sets up. There is lower confidence in these higher totals but not impossible under certain scenarios. Mountain areas will likely receive 3 to 8 inches of snow. * WHERE...North to south Laramie Mountain Range south and southeastward across the High Plains of Albany, Laramie, Platte, Goshen, Banner, and Kimball Counties. * WHEN...Now through mid-day Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Caution is advised if traveling along I-80 or I-25 and state highways in the areas mentioned above. Brief poor visibilities and winter weather conditions could occur.
